page.title: 13AMBULANCE STATION
page.content: NEAR TO OUR SCHOOL THERE IS THE LOCAL AMBULANCE STATION., MR.AMOS, THE MAN IN CHARGE OF THE STATION, CAME INTO SCHOOL AND TOLD US ABOUT A DAY AT THE STATION. THEY GET A LOT OF EMERGENCIES EVERY DAY.THE MOST COMMON BEING CAR ACCIDENTS AND ACCIDENTS INVOLVING PEOPLE TRIPPING AND FALLING DOWN THE STAIRS. SOMETIMES THEY HAVE TO GO OUT TO THE ROACHES (AN OUTCROP OF ROCK JUST OUTSIDE LEEK) TO ATTEND TO PEOPLE WHO HAVE HURT THEMSELVES FALLING FROM THE ROCKS. IF IT IS WINTER THE CLIMBERS ARE SOMETIMES SUFFERING FROM HYPOTHERMIA. THEY ALSO TAKE PEOPLE TO HOSPITAL IF THEY CANNOT GET THERE THEMSELVES. USUALLY IT IS THE ELDERLEY WHO ARE TAKEN. MR.AMOS IS VERY HAPPY BEING AN AMBULANCE MAN. HE SAYS HE GETS A GREAT DEAL OF SATISFACTION FROM HIS JOB.
